meanings.definition: The transportation of a patient, especially a military patient, by helicopter to a hospital.
meanings.sent1: The medivac arrived swiftly to transport the injured soldier to the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The military medivac service is crucial for quickly getting wounded soldiers medical help.
meanings.sent3: The medivac helicopter swooped in like a hero to rescue the injured soldier.
meanings.sent4: The medivac was like a guardian angel, swiftly carrying the wounded to safety.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the approaching medivac was a beacon of hope for the injured soldier.

meanings.definition: To transport a patient, especially a military patient, by helicopter to a hospital.
meanings.sent1: The medical team had to medivac the injured soldier to the nearest hospital.
meanings.sent2: They decided to medivac the patient to ensure quick medical attention.
meanings.sent3: The helicopter will medivac the patient to the hospital in no time.
meanings.sent4: In times of emergency, it's crucial to medivac patients promptly.
meanings.sent5: The decision to medivac the injured soldier saved precious time and possibly his life.
